meanings.definition: To make small changes to improve or correct something, especially a photograph.
meanings.sent1: She decided to retouch the photo to remove a small blemish.
meanings.sent2: Photographers often retouch images to enhance their quality.
meanings.sent3: After a failed attempt, she tried to retouch the photo but made it look even worse!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a skilled artist's brush, delicately retouching the memories in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The painter carefully retouched the colors on the canvas, bringing the scene to life.

meanings.definition: A small change made to improve or correct something, especially a photograph.
meanings.sent1: The retouch on the photo made a significant difference in its appearance.
meanings.sent2: He noticed a retouch in the corner of the picture that enhanced its overall look.
meanings.sent3: The retouch on the photo seemed to have a magical effect, making everyone look perfect!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a retouch on a dull day, brightening everything around her.
meanings.sent5: The retouch on the old photograph brought back memories of a forgotten time.
